text:
**BUYER BEWARE**
I recently opened a moneylion account and transfered money into my account. Shortly after, I was locked out of my account for no apparently reason, they asked for pic of my ID (front and back) and pic of myself holding my ID along with a recent bill showing my address.  I did everything they asked, for them to say the documents looked scanned...No SH!T they're scanned, I made a PDF of the info and sent it to them, and OF COURSE they were scanned with my phone and a pic of me holding my ID.

PLEASE BEWARE of MoneyLion, they stole my money.
title: **BUYER BEWARE** of MoneyLion

text: Terrible service on the account. They advertise they want your direct deposit. I split my direct deposit between my bank and MoneyLion. The part that goes to my bank had no problems. They money lion deposit portion was held up and then into the weekend where they said they couldn't escalate the matter until Monday. The reps were polite but any answers or resolution was essentially gas lighting me. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT put all your money into a money lion account.

text:
I had a credit builder account. In these accounts they open it with $1000 credit line. 
Up front they give you a small percentage. Then once you pay it off they give you the rest. Or at least that's how it's supposed to work. 

I paid mine in full going on two months ago now. The money never came. 
I contacted them and they kept telling me to wait. After a month I contacted them again, then they started saying they sent it already and it was deposited. 

I checked my bank....nope. called my bank....nope. 
Contacted money lion again and they said I had to give them my personal bank statements with ALL of my info or else they couldn't verify I didn't get the money. 

After much reluctance and a week later I finally sent the statement. Showing proof I had never recieved anything from them. 

It's now been almost a month after that and I still have not received anything. All they do is keep emailing me saying they are still working on it. 

They have my bank statement. They can clearly see I never received the money. 

At this point they've stolen over $850 from me and if you are considering using this company I highly discourage it. 

I was depending on that return for other bills. 
They do not care and they will not help. Also every email they send has a number at the bottom you can "call" that leads to a dead phone line

Update: they have finally said they sent the money though I have not received it yet. 
And then they turned around and wrote my account as a charge off on my credit report. Not during this entire process. But after this initial review and fighting for my own money. 

Do not use this company
title: They stole over $850. Do not use this company!

reply.message: We are sorry to hear about your recent experience, and we'd like to see how we can better assist. Please complete this form by copying and pasting it into your web browser: https://mlion.info/customerhelp, and a member of our Advocacy Team will contact you directly.

text:
I signed up and downloaded the app to play along with Beast Games contests. I earned multiple entries.
When I attempted to verify my account, I learned that someone had created a fraudulent account with my SSN and DOB. I called MoneyLion to resolve it. They informed me that if I can't log into the other account, the fraudulent account, that they will have to disable both accounts and I can never have an account. Because of this, I have lost my entries to the Beast Games contests. 
Apparently if your information is compromised MoneyLion doesn't help, they just ban you for life.
title: ID Fraud = Victim gets banned.

reply.message: We are very sorry for your experience, Dave. If this is something you'd like to discuss further, please copy and paste this form into your web browser: https://mlion.info/customerhelp. Once submitted, a Customer Advocate will reach out to you directly.

text: My account was locked because they suspected fraud. I have had this account for three years and used it as my primary account for day to day for that entire time. This year I visited my sister in Hamilton Ontario. I paid for some groceries and things. Next thing I know, I cannot get into my account. This was three weeks ago. I've been sending my ID to their fraud department probably 4 times now. Every time they won't accept it. Screen shot. Scanned. Can't see one of the corners. Last one I sent they said it was a screenshot. It wasn't! I don't know how to get them to accept my ID and give me back access. Don't use this company. You will end up having problems. I guarantee it. As soon as I get my money back (assuming I ever do) I am closing my account for good.
title: My account was locked

title: SCAM

text:
Well I'm going on day five of my three to five day response time for my issue, and it's not looking good.
I really thought this would be an easy fix because clearly I have completed the milestones I needed to pass within the timeframe allotted.  I sent screenshots showing I was well beyond the levels I needed credit for and honestly I can't figure out how you could cheat or fake that,  but idk.
Anyway, it's only about $5, but when I contacted their customer service via email they were kinda rude. I was asked if I was even the owner of the account, which is stupid because why would I be wasting my time if it wasn't my account.
So, I'll be back to update this after tomorrow, again, the fifth day.
Also I found the first time I submitted my ticket and that was way back on January 12.
And I had a slightly similar issue on kashkick but it was for $10 and they fixed it in one day with only four emails.

Ok, so now its January 28th, so 16 days, and  I received an email saying they were closing my ticket since they hadn't heard from me, which is ridiculous because I was told to wait for a response from them.
So I told them they issue was still not resolved and if they close the ticket I will make a new one.
So about 3 days ago in an email I was told there are still no updates but they are working on it.
I went and looked at the specific game and I still have 54 days left to finish the missions.
All the other missions are checked off except the last 3, so to me, once again, I don't know what the deal is. I even sent pics of the screen time spent on the game and it over 9 hours. To me, the proof is all there so I don't know what needs to be investigated. But none the less, I put in the time and I will persist until I get the credits that are due to me.
title: Well I'm going on day five of my three…

text:
I have been a MoneyLion user since approximately 2016 and have observed several platform iterations during this time. While the core concept holds merit, and customer service is generally responsive, certain aspects of the platform require improvement.

The Instacash feature, while potentially beneficial for short-term financial needs, presents significant fee-related concerns. The relatively low borrowing limits, typically around $100, coupled with per-transaction fees, can result in substantial costs for users. Furthermore, exceeding the borrowing limit can lead to even higher fees, exacerbating financial burdens.

The user interface, while offering a wealth of information, can feel cluttered and impede efficient navigation towards personal financial data. Moreover, the frequency of promotional communications, including text messages and emails, can be perceived as excessive and intrusive
title: Good for investing not personal gain.

reply.message: Wow, thank you so much for this valuable feedback, Ethan! We are so grateful to have members like you who give us their honest thoughts. We'll certainly forward this along, thanks again!
